label: AB3C_hP30_193_g_gk_bd-001
title: Ordered TmBO$_{3}$ Structure
comments:
(Newnham, 1963) found two possible structures for TmBO$_{3}$ and YBO$_{3}$: \begin{itemize} \item A compact hexagonal cell with \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B5C_hP18_194_h_fh_a-001}{partially disordered boron and oxygen atoms}, and \item this structure, which has a larger hexagonal cell but completely ordered atoms. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 There are several problems with this structure: \begin{itemize} \item The ICSD entry 27942 places this structure in space group $P\overline{6}c2$ \#188 even though the positions are such that the structure can be resolved in the higher symmetry $P6_{3}/mcm$ space group, and \item the positions of the O I atoms are such that the O-O distance is less than 1{\AA}. \item The ICSD entry gives what seem to be reasonable O-O distances, so we use those coordinates, using AFLOW to transform the structure into space group $P6_{3}/mcm$. \end{itemize}.
